channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: John Fetterman, hoodie-wearing giant of the Senate, to release ‘unapologetic’ memoir in the fall: ‘Unfettered’
item.description: One of Washington's most recognizable politicians, with an imposing height of 6 feet, 8 inches, Fetterman worked on the book with Buzz Bissinger of “F...

item.title: Ozzy Osbourne’s Coffin Will Be Taken Through His Hometown’s Streets Before Funeral
item.description: A cortege took the singer’s coffin through the streets of his hometown, Birmingham, England, on Wednesday.

item.title: Wallis Annenberg, whose family made billions from selling to Rupert Murdoch and poured them back into California, dead at 86
item.description: The Wallis Annenberg Wildlife Crossing, the world's largest bridge for animals on the move, will open next year over an LA freeway.

item.title: Trump calls India ‘our friend’ but slaps 25% tariff down plus additional ‘penalty’ because it’s buying oil from Russia
item.description: Trump also said the outlines of a trade agreement with India had not yet been finalized.

item.title: U.S. Economy Slowed in First Half of 2025 as Tariffs Scrambled Data
item.description: Gross domestic product rebounded in the spring after contracting at the start of the year, but consumer spending remained weak.

item.title: ‘Everybody’s complaining they ain’t never seen it this hot’: Central and Eastern U.S. suffers through ‘dangerous and prolonged’ heat
item.description: The all-time high temperature at Tampa International Airport was broken on Sunday when the thermometer hit 100 degrees Fahrenheit (37.8 degrees Celsiu...

item.title: Tsunami Reaches U.S., and Trump’s Former Lawyer Confirmed as Judge
item.description: Plus, how people are helping discover new species with their phones.

item.title: Big companies have settled on the best way to offer abortion care to employees post-Roe: Quietly
item.description: Three years ago, companies adopted benefits to help cover the costs of travel for employees who needed an abortion but lived in a state where the proc...

item.title: Pro-Palestinian Protest Group Can Appeal U.K. Ban, Judge Rules
item.description: A High Court judge in London said that Palestine Action had the right to challenge the British government’s decision to ban it as a terrorist group.

item.title: A Seaside Refuge in Gaza, Torn Apart by an Israeli Strike
item.description: The Israeli military said it killed at least three Hamas operatives at Al-Baqa Cafe. It also killed a journalist, an artist and two best friends recon...

item.title: Brazil’s President Lula Voices Frustration With Trump Amid Tariff Battle
item.description: Faced with threats of 50 percent tariffs and demands to end a criminal case, President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva said he wouldn’t take orders from Pre...

item.title: Palm Beach Billionaires Battle for Oceanfront Land
item.description: Before building the beachfront homes of their dreams, the superrich keep tearing down perfectly good mansions.

item.title: Here’s the latest on the tsunami.
item.description: The 8.7-magnitude earthquake off Russia’s coast led to warnings and advisories for parts of Japan, Hawaii and Alaska.

item.title: Live Updates: Higher Waves Reach California After Major Pacific Quake
item.description: Countries on both sides of the Pacific issued tsunami warnings after an 8.8-magnitude quake off Russia’s coast. Hours later, there were no immediate r...

item.title: Here Are the Best Rides at Universal’s New Epic Universe Theme Park in Orlando
item.description: A roller coaster aficionado tested all the rides at the new Universal theme park in Orlando and ranks them, from must-dos to mehs in a ride-by-ride gu...
